hedline.hl1: DDB Agency Lands Exxon Unit Account

abstract.p: Exxon Mobil Corp names DDB Worldwide to handle account for what company calls its global fuels marketing portfolio, which includes service stations and convenience stories; billings estimated at $100 million (Advertising column) (S)

block.p: The Exxon Mobil Corporation has named DDB Worldwide in New York, part of the Omnicom Group, to handle the account for what the company calls its global fuels marketing portfolio, which includes service stations and convenience stores. Billings were estimated at $100 million.

Lauren Kerr, a spokeswoman for Exxon Mobil in Fairfax, Va., confirmed a report of the selection this week in Advertising Age, adding that the decision came after a six-week review between the two agencies that worked for Exxon and Mobil before the companies merged to form Exxon Mobil.

The Exxon Mobil Corporation has named DDB Worldwide in New York, part of the Omnicom Group, to handle the account for what the company calls its global fuels marketing portfolio, which includes service stations and convenience stores. Billings were estimated at $100 million.

Lauren Kerr, a spokeswoman for Exxon Mobil in Fairfax, Va., confirmed a report of the selection this week in Advertising Age, adding that the decision came after a six-week review between the two agencies that worked for Exxon and Mobil before the companies merged to form Exxon Mobil.

DDB, the agency for Mobil since 1949, competed against the Houston office of McCann-Erickson Worldwide Advertising, the agency for Exxon and predecessors like Standard Oil of New Jersey since 1912. McCann-Erickson -- part of the McCann-Erickson World Group, a unit of the Interpublic Group of Companies -- will continue to work on a portion of the global lubricants marketing assignment.
